synopsis: In this heartfelt episode of 'Pineapple Blunt Rotation,' hosts Devam and Ahir, along with their guest Gara, dive deep into the complexities of breakups and personal growth. They share their experiences, coping mechanisms, and the importance of self-discovery, ultimately finding strength in vulnerability and connection.
quotes: You have to learn how to listen to yourself instead of getting pulled in every direction possible by your anxious brain.
I think the point was to just live it because you couldn't assign some all-powerful meaning to it.
It's okay that the pizza is lukewarm and floppy; it still satisfied my hunger.
I had to realize that your brain is a machine, and sometimes it hurts us.
You need to keep reminding yourself that your happiness is worth something, even if it's just you.
When you're in that storm, you have to remember: I am the sky, not the clouds.
It's not that I don't think about it anymore; it's just that I can live my life without it consuming me.
You have to give yourself grace; it's okay to feel weak and helpless sometimes.
Every day is an opportunity to choose your happiness.
You can still love somebody and not be in a relationship with them.
